intro: Morisonia petiolaris, commonly known as the redroot sandwort, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Montiaceae family and is characterized by its compact, low-growing habit. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically opposite, linear, and covered in fine hairs. Morisonia petiolaris thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats such as dunes or disturbed areas.
